unnormalised: **Environmental News: Wildlife Conservation Efforts Bear Fruit in Maharashtra**
normalised: Environmental News: Wildlife Conservation Efforts Bear Fruit in Maharashtra

unnormalised: Recent surveys indicate a positive trend in tiger populations within the Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve, Maharashtra, a crucial habitat corridor. Forest officials attribute this success to rigorous anti-poaching patrols and community-based conservation initiatives involving local Gond tribes.
normalised: Recent surveys indicate a positive trend in tiger populations within the Tadoba-Andhari Tiger Reserve, Maharashtra, a crucial habitat corridor. Forest officials attribute this success to rigorous anti-poaching patrols and community-based conservation initiatives involving local Gond tribes.

unnormalised: The Wildlife Institute of India (WII), Dehradun, is collaborating with the Maharashtra Forest Department on a multi-year project to study tiger movement and genetic diversity using camera trapping and DNA analysis. Their findings will help inform future conservation strategies, including habitat management and mitigation of human-wildlife conflict.
normalised: The Wildlife Institute of India (W I I), Dehradun, is collaborating with the Maharashtra Forest Department on a multi-year project to study tiger movement and genetic diversity using camera trapping and D N A analysis. Their findings will help inform future conservation strategies, including habitat management and mitigation of human-wildlife conflict.

unnormalised: Remember the powerful message of the film 'Sherni'? Real-world conservation requires similar dedication. Educating villagers about sustainable practices, providing alternative livelihood options, and enforcing existing wildlife protection laws under the Wildlife Protection Act, 1972 are key to ensuring the continued success of these efforts. The proposed expansion of the protected area by 500 sq km will further strengthen wildlife corridors. Let's hope this progress continues!
normalised: Remember the powerful message of the film 'Sherni'? Real-world conservation requires similar dedication. Educating villagers about sustainable practices, providing alternative livelihood options, and enforcing existing wildlife protection laws under the Wildlife Protection Act, one thousand nine hundred and seventy two are key to ensuring the continued success of these efforts. The proposed expansion of the protected area by five hundred square kilometer will further strengthen wildlife corridors. Let's hope this progress continues!
